metadata.title: CVE-2024-7883 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: When using Arm Cortex-M Security Extensions (CMSE), Secure stack contents canbe leaked to Non-secure state via floating-point registers when a Secure toNon-secure function call is made that returns a floating-point value and whenthis is the first use of floating-point since entering Secure state. Thisallows an attacker to read a limited quantity of Secure stack contents with animpact on confidentiality. This issue is specific to code generated usingLLVM-based compilers.

criterions.comment: llvm-toolchain-11 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
llvm-toolchain-12 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
llvm-toolchain-13 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
llvm-toolchain-14 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
llvm-toolchain-15 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
